Dispute_Type: Judicial review of citizenship application decision
Legal_Issue: Sufficiency of reasons provided by citizenship judge and compliance with residence requirements
Procedural_Context: Judicial review initiated by the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration
Legal_Provision: Residence requirement: at least three years in Canada within four years before application
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet statutory residence requirement
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Gaps in residence evidence and lack of clarity in judicial reasoning
Application_Error: Insufficient explanation of test used (intention vs. physical presence)
Review_Outcome: Remitted to another citizenship judge for redetermination
Evidence_Ignored: Contradictions in travel records and insufficient proof of residence
Legal_Standard: Residence requirement under the Citizenship Act
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the judge applied correct legal test and addressed evidentiary gaps
Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent evidence and unclear judicial reasoning on residence compliance
Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictory travel records, lack of documented physical presence
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to address material gaps in evidence
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's residence claims deemed questionable due to inconsistencies
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Minister challenged the citizenship judge’s decision on grounds of inadequate reasoning
Procedural_Issue: Insufficient reasons provided by decision maker
Omission_Type: Failure to address contradictions in evidence and clarify legal test applied
